arcade.sim

Interface Simulation

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GrowthSimulation, GrowthSimulation.Hexagonal, GrowthSimulation.Rectangular

    public interface Simulation
    A Simulation object sets up the agents and environments for a simulation.

    A Simulation consists of stepping the model for a given random seed. At the start, agents and environments are added the instance and scheduled. Any additional steppables, such as profilers and checkpoints, are also scheduled.

    A Simulation should also extend SimState from the MASON library. SimState manages the actual "stepping" of the model, while the Simulation interface ensures the model can interact with other interfaces and classes in the package.

    Since:
    2.2
    Version:
    2.3.8

      static interface  Simulation.Representation
      A Representation object defines the simulation representation.

      • getRandom

        double getRandom()
        Gets a random number from a seeded random number generator.

        Random number is between 0.0 and 1.0. Using this instead of Math.random() to ensure simulations can be replicated for the same seed.

        Returns:
        a random number

      • getRepresentation

        Simulation.Representation getRepresentation()
        Gets the Simulation.Representation object for the current simulation.
        Returns:
        the Simulation.Representation instance

      • getSeed

        int getSeed()
        Gets the random number generator seed.
        Returns:
        the random seed

      • getSeries

        Series getSeries()
        Gets the Series object for the current simulation.

        The Series object can be further queried for information on configuration and parameters.

        Returns:
        the Series instance

      • getTime

        double getTime()
        Gets the simulation time (in minutes) from the underlying schedule.
        Returns:
        the simulation time

      • setupAgents

        void setupAgents()
        Sets up the agent in the grid for the simulation.

        The concrete implementing class calls this method setupEnvironment() methods from the library start() method, which is called before the schedule starts stepping the simulation.

      • setupEnvironment

        void setupEnvironment()
        Sets up the environment using lattices for the simulation.

        The concrete implementing class calls this and setupAgents() methods from the library start() method, which is called before the schedule starts stepping the simulation.

      • shuffle

        static void shuffle(java.util.ArrayList<?> list,
                    ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast rng)
        Shuffles the given list using a seeded random number generator.

        The list is shuffled in placed. Based on java.util.Collections and adapted to use the seeded random number generator.

        Parameters:
        list - the list to be shuffled
        rng - the random number generator

      • swap

        static void swap(java.lang.Object[] arr,
                 int i,
                 int j)
        Swaps two objects in an array in place.
        Parameters:
        arr - the array containing the objects
        i - the index of the first object
        j - the index of the second object
